description: In the wake of the Charleston church massacre, South Carolina Lawmakers consider removing the Confederate battle flag from the Capitol.
title: Briefing: South Carolina Votes to Remove the Confederate Battle Flag
title_page: Briefing: South Carolina Votes to Remove the Confederate Battle Flag  - The New York Times
text:
What happens next?
A spokesman for Ms. Haley said the governor would sign the bill to remove the flag at 4 p.m. on Thursday, and that the flag will come down at 10 a.m. on Friday.
The next challenge will be actually getting it down. It sits on a high gunmetal black pole, but there is no winch or rope at ground-level that would make it easy for a person to lower it without special equipment.
At around 10 a.m. Thursday, two capitol building workmen were consulting with a man, apparently on the mechanics of bringing it down â€“ there was talk of whether a box truck, like the kind used by electrical repairmen, would be needed. Neither provided an answer on the plan for removal.
